Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

@Ovilia 

textStyle
Global font style.
https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#textStyle

For example:
textStyle.fontFamily = 'Avenir Next'

besides just
'serif' , 'monospace', ...

Any custom font we may want to include in the page, can Echarts expand to support it? Can we point ECharts to the font we include? Any of the sort besides just a set list of fonts. Not sure what more of an explanation can be given. The ability to use any custom font we want to use besides the defaults.
@Ovilia because of that, this issue was marked as "new-feature" and not a "support" question. May you could add the "new-feature" label again? In my opinion this is a missing feature.

Thanks for your contribution!
The community will review it ASAP. In the meanwhile, please checkout [the coding standard](https://echarts.apache.org/en/coding-standard.html) and Wiki about [How to make a pull request](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/wiki/How-to-make-a-pull-request).
It seems to be a bug brought by #11743 and should will be fixed soon.

Maybe the label should be centered vertically?

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

Custom fonts are supported. You should load the fonts with CSS and set [fontFamily](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#textStyle.fontFamily) to the name of those fonts.

@Ejstn The issue was closed because lack of activity (5 month).
I made a demo: https://codepen.io/Ovilia/pen/ExVreNE
This is not a bug but I do think it's useful to make a feature like this. Further discussion required.
For now, @YiYingWu1302 you have to make a fake data with zero values and set axis max value.

Use https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-bar.markPoint and set it's data to be the percentage. If you want the shape as in the image, set https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-bar.markPoint.symbol to be the SVG path value.
I see, thanks a lot for your reply :)
@Ovilia  Wow, I see. That's great and thanks for the demo. My bad, it didnt occur to me because the documentation says only "Can also be 'serif', 'monospace', ..."
